Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior glazed black; exterior, in reserved handle zone, Triton (unclothed; red hair and beard) to right, holding fish in left hand; reserved band on lower wall.
Curator's comments: See BM B600.23 and the band cup, Athens, Agora P 3853 (Agora xxiii pl. 111 no. 1697).
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B600.24)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 403, B601)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XIII, no. 9)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1362) (phase 3)
